texts.textentryhtml: Bought from Mrs. Florence Cole Vincent, Cole's granddaughter at his Catskill studio

bibliography.boilertext: Tara Dawson, Bartholomew F. Bland, and Laura L. Vookles, et. al., The panoramic river: the Hudson and the Thames, (Yonkers, NY: Hudson River Museum, 2013).
bibliography.citation: Tara Dawson, Bartholomew F. Bland, and Laura L. Vookles, et. al., The panoramic river: the Hudson and the Thames, (Yonkers, NY: Hudson River Museum, 2013).

bibliography.boilertext: Barbara T. Ross, American Drawings in the Art Museum, Princeton University: 130 Selected Examples (Princeton: Art Museum, Princeton University, 1976).
bibliography.citation: Barbara T. Ross, American Drawings in the Art Museum, Princeton University: 130 Selected Examples (Princeton: Art Museum, Princeton University, 1976)., p. 133

bibliography.boilertext: John Wilmerding et al., American Art in the Princeton University Art Museum: volume 1: drawings and watercolors, (Princeton: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT; London: Yale University Press, 2004)
bibliography.citation: John Wilmerding et al., American Art in the Princeton University Art Museum: volume 1: drawings and watercolors, (Princeton: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT; London: Yale University Press, 2004), pp. 301–302, checklist no. 140

bibliography.boilertext: George Field, Chromatography: or, A treatise on colours and pigments, and of their powers in painting, &c., (London: Charles Tilt, 1835).
bibliography.citation: George Field, Chromatography: or, A treatise on colours and pigments, and of their powers in painting, &c., (London: Charles Tilt, 1835)., Inscription is from this work.

bibliography.boilertext: David Bjelajac, "Thomas Cole's oxbow and the American Zion divided", American art 20, no.1 (Spring, 2006): p. 60-83.
bibliography.citation: David Bjelajac, "Thomas Cole's oxbow and the American Zion divided", American art 20, no.1 (Spring, 2006): p. 60-83., p. 68, fig. 7
